html:
Click the following link to watch video: https://share.newscasts.refinitiv.com/link?entryId=1_1zqb46dh&referenceId=1_1zqb46dh&pageId=RefinitivNewscasts
Source: Reuters

Description: The number of Americans filling new claims for unemployment benefits dropped to the lowest level in more than 52 years last week as labor market conditions continued to tighten amid an acute worker shortage. A deal between top Democrats and Republicans in the Senate to help raise the federal government's $28.9 trillion debt limit will be tested today when the full chamber votes on whether to approve the measure. Wall Street's main indexes have slipped at the open after logging three straight days of gains on positive updates on the Omicron Covid19 variant. Investors focus is now returning to economic data for clues on the Fed's policy decision. Italy has fined Amazon $1.3 billion dollars for alleged abuse of market dominance - in what is one of the biggest penalties imposed on a U.S. technology company in Europe. The European Commission has announced draft rules to give workers for companies such as UBER and Deliveroo employment rights and benefits.
Short Link: https://refini.tv/3dypHnJ
